```{r}
library(spatstat)

data(chorley)

ch <- unique.ppp(chorley)
ch_lung <- ch[ch$marks=="lung",]
ch_lar <- ch[ch$marks=="larynx",]

lambda <- summary(ch)$intensity
lambda

q <- quadratcount(ch, nx=4,ny=2)
q_lung <- quadratcount(ch_lung, nx=4,ny=2)
q_lar <- quadratcount(ch_lar, nx=4,ny=2)

plot(ch, cex=0.5)
plot(q, add=T, cex=2)


plot(ch_lung, cex=0.5)
plot(q_lung, add=T, cex=2)


plot(ch_lar, cex=0.5)
plot(q_lar, add=T, cex=2)

#so the quadrats are not the same size, so we need to correct for that

den <- density.ppp(ch, sigma=2, kernel='gaussian')
den_lung <- density.ppp(ch_lung, sigma=2, kernel='gaussian')
den_lar <- density.ppp(ch_lar, sigma=2, kernel='gaussian')

plot(den)
plot(ch, add=T, cex=.1)

plot(den_lung)
plot(ch_lung, add=T, cex=.1)

plot(den_lar)
plot(ch_lar, add=T, cex=.1)

persp(den)
persp(den_lung)
persp(den_lar)

contour(den)
contour(den_lung)
contour(den_lar)

aden <- adaptive.density(ch, f=0.01, nrep=10)
plot(aden)
plot(ch, add=T, cex=0.1)

this.window <- ch$window
csr.test <- quadrat.test(ch, nx=4, ny=4, method="Chisq")
csr.test
plot(ch, color='blue')
plot(csr.test, add=T, color="red")

csr.test_lung <- quadrat.test(ch_lung, nx=4, ny=4, method="Chisq")
csr.test_lung
plot(ch, color='blue')
plot(csr.test_lung, add=T, color="red")

csr.test_lar <- quadrat.test(ch_lar, nx=4, ny=4, method="Chisq")
csr.test_lar
plot(ch, color='blue')
plot(csr.test_lar, add=T, color="red")


csr.test
csr.test_lung
csr.test_lar

```

based on these results we reject the null hypothesis that these points exhibit complete spatial randomness, but 
this doesn't tell us what is driving the distribution of the points, just that they aren't CSR.
